description: Hackfinity was an international CTF battle for students hosted by TryHackMe, featuring challenges in web applications, OSINT, and boot-to-root scenarios. It offers hands-on practice under time pressure and collaboration with peers.

Certified in Cybersecurity (CC) from ISC² is an entry-level credential covering foundational security principles, business continuity, and network defense. It validates knowledge of access control concepts and prepared me for further specialization in cybersecurity.

Advent of Cyber is TryHackMe’s annual December event delivering 24 daily challenges that introduce red and blue teaming fundamentals. I learned to analyze logs, perform Wi-Fi attacks, and practice defensive monitoring in a festive format.

Cyber Security 101 is a beginner-friendly pathway that builds core skills in Linux, Windows, and networking fundamentals. Labs guide you through Metasploit usage and essential red and blue team toolsets.

DevSecOps on TryHackMe focuses on integrating security into CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and infrastructure as code. I explored Docker, Kubernetes, and secure IaC practices through hands-on labs.
The Hacker Methodology course on TryHackMe walks through a structured ethical hacking workflow using Kali Linux. I learned reconnaissance, scanning & exploitation techniques.

The Junior Penetration Tester pathway provided practical training in web hacking, network scanning, and use of offensive tools. Modules cover Burp Suite, Nmap enumeration, and Metasploit exploitation workflows.
Google’s Cloud Cybersecurity Professional Certificate on offered a self-paced, 5 part program teaching core concepts in cloud security, threat analysis & incident response.

Security Engineer Training on TryHackMe explored secure software development, system hardening, and incident management. The pathway includes modules on SAST/DAST and operational best practices for robust defense.
Attacking and Defending AWS is a hands-on path teaching how to secure and exploit AWS environments. Labs cover EC2 misconfigurations, S3 security, Lambda vulnerabilities, and remediation strategies.
Web Fundamentals introduces web application structures and teaches exploitation techniques for common vulnerabilities. I practiced IDOR, SSRF, and SQL injection attacks in realistic lab environments.
Web Application Fundamentals builds on the basics to cover advanced web vulnerabilities and exploitation techniques. I learned about various attack vectors to target web applications.
